name: Seinfeld
description: Iconic quotes and catchphrases from the show about nothing that became everything.
author: Quips Editorial

quotes.notes: Based on real NYC soup vendor Al Yeganeh. The episode made Thomas an icon; he was nominated for an Emmy.
Frank's anger management technique that backfires. Later revealed: 'Serenity now, insanity later.'
Originally Yiddish expression. The episode explored using it to skip uncomfortable story details.

quotes.content: These pretzels are making me thirsty!
quotes.notes: Kramer's one line in a Woody Allen film. Each character delivers it differently throughout the episode.

quotes.content: Not that there's anything wrong with that.
quotes.notes: Jerry and George's repeated qualifier about being mistaken for gay. Won a GLAAD Media Award.

quotes.content: I'm out there, Jerry, and I'm lovin' every minute of it!
quotes.notes: Kramer's enthusiastic embrace of life without underwear. Peak Kramer eccentricity.
Kramer's catchphrase expressing enthusiasm. Used throughout the series run.

quotes.content: Festivus for the rest of us!
quotes.notes: Created by writer Dan O'Keefe's real family. December 23rd Festivus celebrations now occur worldwide.
George's excuse for 'shrinkage.' The episode coined the term for mainstream audiences.
Jerry's disdainful greeting to his nemesis. Wayne Knight played the postal worker Newman.

quotes.content: It's not a lie if you believe it.
quotes.notes: George's philosophy on deception and self-delusion. Core to his character's psychology.

quotes.content: I don't want to be a pirate!
quotes.notes: Jerry forced to wear the puffy shirt on Today Show. The actual shirt is in the Smithsonian.

quotes.content: The jerk store called, and they're running out of you!
quotes.notes: George's delayed comeback. The episode satirizes the obsession with the perfect retort.

quotes.content: I'm not a lesbian. I hate men, but I'm not a lesbian.
quotes.notes: Elaine's clarification during the mistaken identity episode. Julia Louis-Dreyfus' comedic timing shines.
Jerry's alternative to 'God bless you' after sneezes. A running bit about social conventions.
Frank's alternative outburst to 'Serenity now.' Jerry Stiller's delivery made it memorable.
George's lie to impress a woman. Classic George self-delusion and overreach.
Bania's catchphrase about his hacky comedy material. A recurring annoyance for Jerry.
George's phone greeting, never saying hello. A character quirk throughout the series.
George's go-to fake profession when lying. Art Vandelay is his fictional architecture firm.
Jerry's exclamation of disgust. The delivery varies from resigned to outraged throughout the series.

quotes.content: The sea was angry that day, my friends.
quotes.notes: Opening of George's dramatic whale rescue story. One of the show's most beloved monologues.

quotes.content: You want a piece of me?
quotes.notes: Frank's aggressive challenge. Jerry Stiller's intensity made Frank a fan favorite.

quotes.content: I have no eye for fashion.
quotes.notes: Elaine's self-assessment about style. Ironic given the show's influence on 90s fashion.

quotes.content: We're taking it up a notch!
quotes.notes: Elaine's enthusiasm for escalating situations. Part of her character's bold, assertive nature.
